page.title: 11THE STATE CINEMA, GRAYS
page.content: The State Cinema was built in George Street in 1938. Through the years many people have enjoyed films that have been shown. In February 1985 a conservation order was put on the building after an application had been made to demolish the cinema for a development scheme. The cinema is rated as being the most complete and unaltered building of its type in Britain. The State also has one of the few remaining{COMPTON {THEATRE ORGANS}in the country. The B.B.C. used the cinema in June 1985 to record sequences for a programme about the{BLUEBELL DANCING {GIRLS.} Local people are supporting a campaign to keep the State open and prevent the closure of the only remaining cinema in Grays.
